content.question: A student determines that an unknown compound contains <math alttext="49" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>49</mn></math> percent <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> by mass. Which of the following could be the compound?

choices.label: The figure shows the structure of a compound labeled Propanoic acid, 74 grams per mole. The following atoms are arranged horizontally and are each connected by a single bond: H C C C O H. The first and second C atoms are each connected to two additional H atoms, each by single bonds. The third C atom is connected to an additional O atom by a double bond.

The figure shows the structure of a compound labeled Butanoic acid, 88 grams per mole. The following atoms are arranged horizontally and are each connected by a single bond: H C C C C O H. The first, second, and third C atoms are each connected to two additional H atoms, each by single bonds. The fourth C atom is connected to an additional O atom by a double bond.

The figure shows the structure of a compound labeled Lactic acid, 90 grams per mole. The following atoms are arranged horizontally and are each connected by a single bond: H C C C O H. The first C atom is connected to two additional H atoms, each by single bonds. The second C atom is connected to an H atom and an O atom, each by a single bond. The O atom is connected to an H atom by a single bond. The third C atom is connected to an additional O atom by a double bond.

The figure shows the structure of a compound labeled Glucose, 180 grams per mole. The following atoms are arranged horizontally and are each connected by a single bond: H O C C C C C C. The first C atom is connected to two additional H atoms, each by single bonds. The second, third, and fifth C atoms are connected to H atoms and O atoms, each by single bonds. In each case, the H is above the C, and the O is below the C. Additionally, in each case, the O atom is also connected to an H atom by a single bond. The fourth C atom is connected to an O atom and an H atom, each by a single bond. The O is above the C, the H is below the C. Additionally, the O atom is connected to an H atom by a single bond. The sixth C atom is connected to an H atom by a single bond and an O atom by a double bond.

content.answer: The figure shows the structure of a compound labeled Propanoic acid, 74 grams per mole. The following atoms are arranged horizontally and are each connected by a single bond: H C C C O H. The first and second C atoms are each connected to two additional H atoms, each by single bonds. The third C atom is connected to an additional O atom by a double bond.

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
